column4: i had a crash and then saw grub rescue so i installed a new ubuntu 12.04 system while keeping the previous drive as it is, then i restored its contents via backup and everything's backed up but i can't see the home folder's contents.....but the total size of the drive shows that it is 10 GB and it was 10 GB.......i think my folders in the home folders are hidden or something....plz. help
Please getan oveerview yourslef by doing '~$ df -h'.
then what?
i get this :: /dev/sda8        26G  8.8G   16G  37% /media/3a342190-c4a5-4014-aa12-45be4b2c12a
Then change to your home folder and investigate if it is the home that you wanted.
the /dev/sda8 is the one in which my home folder contents are missing
i backed up /dev/sda8 via superblock backup
May be you need an Ubuntu life CD to find out where your previous /home contents are now.
i tried that but it doesn't help
I do not know anything about superblock.
see this http://i.imgur.com/8oSun.png
this is what i am getting
it doesn't help is no exact description. Either give a more precise description, or visit a local Linux computer club to get help.
in a live CD, what do i need to do?
Is http://i.imgur.com/8oSun.png the output of "superblock"?
nope. that is what i see when i navigate to the 27 GB filesystem (my previuos ubuntu install which crashed)
browse your filesytems for "home" directories.
in the live CD?
yes, using the live CD and investigating the filessystems on your hard disks.
ok
thanks!
Good luck!
